title: Body Layer
description: Four-dimensional Body definition: physical substrate, runtime environment, appearance, and interface (runtime contract / nervous system)

physical.description: Physical embodiment (robots, IoT devices). Not applicable for digital-only agents.

name.description: Unique identifier for the physical body

runtime.description: Digital runtime environment — the platform, channels, credentials, and resources available to this persona.

platform.description: Host platform identifier (e.g., openclaw, zeroclaw, standalone)

channels.description: Communication channels this persona expects (e.g., whatsapp, telegram, moltbook, discord)

scope.description: Credential scope identifier (e.g., moltbook, elevenlabs, github)

shared.description: If true, credential is shared across all personas. If false, private to this persona.

credentials.description: Credential scopes this persona needs — not the secrets themselves, but declarations of what it requires

resources.description: System resources available (e.g., filesystem, network, browser, cron)

avatar.description: URL or path to avatar image

model3d.description: URL or path to 3D model (for XR/metaverse)

style.description: Visual style description (e.g., anime, photorealistic, pixel-art)

interface.description: Runtime contract (nervous system) between persona and host. Declares signal policy and command handling rules.

allowedTypes.description: Allowed signal categories; if omitted all types are permitted. Valid values: scheduling, file_io, tool_missing, capability_gap, resource_limit, agent_communication
Allowed command types from host; if omitted all types are permitted

install.description: Soft reference — external body package to install (e.g., clawhub:robot-arm)
